data.message: i'm using this in wordpress and it's working my only problem is that if you fire 4 ajax calls they start in sequence and what i need is to cancel the other calls before starting the new :S

OK, googled it: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1802936/stop-all-active-ajax-requests-in-jquery

But this is not the only problem/bug you will get, autocomplete is very much more better

I second Moutaz  suggestion of using autocomplete, but if you want to implement yourself, here is my solution: always send a timestamp to the server, and store the last timestamp. The server will send to you the response + the timestamp. When you receive the response, check the received timestamp with the latest timestamp you have, and only handle the response if the timetamps are the same
every ajax call return a xhr handler , and then you can use xhr.stop();

Mohammad Tayseer I don't like to use plugins. at the end of every big project you will find your self with more than 30 plugin and if you update jQuery one of the plugin might not work and then you start to get angry searching for a solution and sometimes changing your logic by this time is too late :)

Mohamed Alaa this means that you will have to rewrite lots of code :) You need to spend sometime evaluating plugins & only plugins with good compatibility history should be used, or at least write your code as plugins & share it with us :)

Mohammad Tayseer Let's be honest together :D how many time a client ask for a Slider and then they want to convert to do some other functionality which the slider it self can't do it or can't be extended. so from my work @Freshout I have my own UI Library and i made them in a way to be extended :)
Mohamed Alaa share them on Github :D
will do it soon iSA just now because we use them for inside projects i can't expose them yet but I'll soon :D
